8.78.text: It will happen to us all at some point.

11.82.text: So negotiating a pain with a measure of reason belongs to the art of living.

17.20.text: A number of tips suggest themselves

19.90.text: Firstly: don't attempt to minimize what's happened

23.16.text: Being brave has no place here.

25.66.text: Allow your sadness so much room, so much time, so many melancholic songs, hot baths and indulgent meals

33.82.text: You'll eventually bore yourself back into an appetite for life.

39.24.text: Secondly: believe them when they said it.

41.76.text: Don't imagine that their past sweetness and kind words provides any covert indications of future commitment.

49.42.text: Kill any remaining hope yourself, if they didn't quite have the courage to do so themselves.

55.62.text: Don't imagine that anyone can love on command

59.68.text: The capacity to feel attracted lies outside the will

63.84.text: It isn't a question of them not trying hard enough

69.80.text: They were not being bad for not loving and nor were you good for wanting them

74.60.text: You were both on the search for pleasure that took you down different and conflicting routes

79.94.text: Our conscious minds ride like tiny boats on the swells of unconscious psychoanalytic and biological seas.

88.04.text: So don't turn this into a morality tale

91.62.text: They acted weirdly around the break-up

93.84.text: not because they were bad or indeed unsure, they just felt terribly guilty

100.00.text: which doesn't, though, mean that they want you

103.62.text: Many of us are predisposed to think especially well of people who don't want us

109.20.text: It feeds into our reserves of self-hatred

115.48.text: The true challenge is to stop being so revolted by people who do in fact want us

121.14.text: and so admiring of those who don't

124.98.text: Think back to when you rejected people

128.02.text: You didn't hate them or regret them

131.00.text: The chief emotions are embarrassment and pity

135.06.text: Don't connect up the rejection with everything you fear and hate about being you

147.20.text: Don't offer them sex in the hope of changing their mind

150.32.text: Don't imagine that people can fall back in love with someone out of pity or of guilt

155.74.text: and don't defensively maintain that they had a fear of intimacy

160.40.text: Just try to laugh and have a few rounds of casual sex if that helps

165.42.text: But above all, don't keep thinking of the end of this relationship as tragically sad

171.00.text: The only good relationship, the only relationship worth mourning

175.72.text: would be one to which two people desperately wanted to belong

180.20.text: And this wasn't, in the end, despite all the promising signs,

184.38.text: that kind of relationship at all.
